bug.short_desc: com-ec updateinitrd.xml does not work with new cluster-py

long_desc.thetext:
the clusterquery command has to be replaced for new versions.
The new command to set the config version should be: cman_tool version -r $(/usr/bin/com-queryclusterconf -q query_value "/cluster/@config_version")
fixed in comoonics-cs-xsl-ec-0.5-17
closed

bug.short_desc: com-ec localclone fails because ACLs can't be copied
bug.cf_releasenotes: added the necessary options if available. Not in Q&A.

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: QA executed com-ec to create a localclone. /boot is not mounted with ACL option and the rsync copy process that is triggered by com-ec fails. Error message:
... set_acl: sys_acl_get_file(.initrd_sr-2.6.18-53.el5.img.6hV8gN, SMB_ACL_TYPE_ACCESS): Operation not supported ... rsync error: some files could not be transferred (code 23) at main.c(892) [sender=2.6.8]
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): release candidate
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. /boot mounted without ACL option 2. com-ec -d -x /opt/atix/comoonics-cs/xsl/localclone.xsl /root/com-ec-tests/local-clone.xm 3.
Actual results: Files can't be copied with ACLs -> rsync fails -> com-ec fails.
Expected results: Files should be copied.
Additional info: Quick fix with the following rsync command
/usr/bin/rsync --archive --update --one-file-system --delete --xattrs /var/lib/com-ec/source/ /var/lib/com-ec/dest/
succeeds. --xattrs option for copying selinux context is available. However ACLs are not copied.
Bug seems to be fixed in new version. Timing tests are scheduled because the copy process seems to take much longer when copying with extended attributes.
Bug is fixed and now files could be optionally copied with full ACL inclusion.
closed

bug.short_desc: [RFE] Update copyright text from ATIX GmbH to ATIX AG
bug.cf_releasenotes: Moved GmbH to AG for ATIX

long_desc.thetext:
Created an attachment (id=1) Occurances of the string 'ATIX GmbH'
Description of problem: A whole bunch of sourcecode files still contain ATIX GmbH as copyright holder. This should be updated to ATIX AG. Also there should be a GPL statement attached to the sourcecode.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. $ find /home/user/cvs/* | xargs grep ATIX\ GmbH
Actual results: ATIX GmbH
Expected results: ATIX AG
Additional info: See attachment for a printout of affected files.

bug.cf_releasenotes: localclone: with GFS it was failing fixed with new parameter.

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: the mount of the destination gfs filesystem fails with /sbin/mount.gfs: error 17 mounting /dev/mapper/vg_lilr202_srC-lv_sharedroot on /cluster/shared/var/lib/com-ec/dest
dmesg: kobject_add failed for lilr202:lt_sharedroot with -EEXIST, don't try to register things with the same name in the same directory.
Call Trace: [<ffffffff8032f0fa>] kobject_add+0x16e/0x199 [<ffffffff88368578>] :gfs:fill_super+0x0/0x6ac [<ffffffff8032f23d>] kobject_register+0x20/0x3a [<ffffffff88368578>] :gfs:fill_super+0x0/0x6ac [<ffffffff883689ea>] :gfs:fill_super+0x472/0x6ac [<ffffffff80261310>] __down_write_nested+0x35/0x9a [<ffffffff802c300d>] kmem_cache_zalloc+0x62/0x80 [<ffffffff802c8ac0>] get_sb_bdev+0x10a/0x164 [<ffffffff802c2f9b>] __kmalloc+0x8f/0x9f [<ffffffff802c845d>] vfs_kern_mount+0x93/0x11a [<ffffffff802c8526>] do_kern_mount+0x36/0x4d [<ffffffff802d1b1f>] do_mount+0x68c/0x6fc [<ffffffff88356479>] :gfs:gfs_glock_dq+0x15c/0x16b [<ffffffff8836b923>] :gfs:gfs_private_nopage+0x8a/0x9f [<ffffffff80208e30>] __handle_mm_fault+0x668/0xf4d [<ffffffff80261869>] _spin_lock_irqsave+0x9/0x14 [<ffffffff8020a945>] get_page_from_freelist+0x1ef/0x391 [<ffffffff8020ee87>] __alloc_pages+0x65/0x2b4 [<ffffffff8022a857>] iput+0x4b/0x84 [<ffffffff8024add7>] sys_mount+0x8a/0xcd [<ffffffff8025d2f1>] tracesys+0xa7/0xb2
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
root@lilr202a:~# rpm -qa | grep gfs kmod-gfs-0.1.19-7.el5 kmod-gfs-xen-0.1.19-7.el5 gfs2-utils-0.1.38-1.el5 kmod-gfs-0.1.19-6.el5 gfs-utils-0.1.12-1.el5
comoonics-bootimage-listfiles-1.3-4.el5 comoonics-cs-xml-0.5-1 comoonics-bootimage-compat-0.1-1 comoonics-bootimage-initscripts-1.3-4.el5 comoonics-bootimage-extras-xen-0.1-2 comoonics-bootimage-fenceclient-ilo-0.1-18 comoonics-bootimage-fenceacksv-0.3-1 comoonics-fenceacksv-py-0.1-1 comoonics-fenceacksv-plugins-py-0.1-1 comoonics-cs-py-0.1-47 comoonics-pythonosfix-py-0.1-1 comoonics-cdsl-py-0.2-3 comoonics-ec-py-0.1-27 comoonics-cs-xsl-ec-0.5-17 comoonics-bootimage-1.3-21 comoonics-cluster-py-0.1-5
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. com-ec localclone 2. 3.
Actual results: localclone fails at mount of destination device
Expected results: localclone should succeed
Additional info:
I opened a redhat bugzilla to adress this issue: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=421161
Idea to workaround/solve the issue: when mounting with lockproto=lock_unlock, also use the parameter locktable=<randomnumber>.

in order to work around the gfs bug, the com-ec way of solving this issue, is to add the mount option locktable to the xml file. The locktable value should be some kind of random value.
<mountpoint name='/'> <option value='lock_nolock' name='lockproto'/> <option value='dfgsafg' name='locktable'/> </mountpoint>
This leads to a change in the copysets.xsl file:
Index: copysets.xsl =================================================================== RCS file: /usr/ATIX/CVSROOT/nashead2004/management/comoonics-clustersuite/xsl/copysets.xsl,v retrieving revision 1.8 diff -u -r1.8 copysets.xsl --- copysets.xsl 7 Aug 2007 15:20:48 -0000 1.8 +++ copysets.xsl 23 Jan 2008 12:32:02 -0000 @@ -429,6 +429,7 @@ <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="$fstype='gfs'"> <option value="lock_nolock" name="lockproto"/> + <option value="hdfhgg" name="locktable"/> </xsl:when> </xsl:choose> </mountpoint>

OK, the last patch was only half the truth, here's the new one:
Index: copysets.xsl =================================================================== RCS file: /usr/ATIX/CVSROOT/nashead2004/management/comoonics-clustersuite/xsl/copysets.xsl,v retrieving revision 1.8 diff -u -r1.8 copysets.xsl --- copysets.xsl 7 Aug 2007 15:20:48 -0000 1.8 +++ copysets.xsl 23 Jan 2008 13:00:28 -0000 @@ -429,6 +429,7 @@ <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="$fstype='gfs'"> <option value="lock_nolock" name="lockproto"/> + <option value="hdfhgg" name="locktable"/> </xsl:when> </xsl:choose> </mountpoint> @@ -495,6 +496,7 @@ <filesystem clustername="{$dclustername}" type="gfs"/> <mountpoint name="{$dmountpoint}"> <option value="lock_nolock" name="lockproto"/> + <option value="jhdshf" name="locktable"/> </mountpoint> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose>
This solution is confirmed by QA.
patch added to cvs to make its way into the next release of comoonics-cs-xsl-ec
will be fixed in comoonics-cs-xsl-ec-0.5-18 Please QA and close.
QA was successful.
closed

bug.short_desc: LVM cache file changed in RHEL 5 and com-ec archive clone fails
bug.cf_releasenotes: ComLVM: changed the code so that everything works with new location of cache files

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: RHEL 5 U1 QA discovered that archive clone is not possible. The following error message is displayed:
-------------------com-ec : ERROR Error occured during execution of enterprisecopy axqa02rc-local-clone in set copy-rootdisk-lvm. Errormessage: LVM could not read lvm cache file.-------------------- 2008-01-23 11:34:52,342 root DEBUG Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/bin/com-ec", line 191, in ? ecopy.doAllsets() File "/usr/lib/python2.4/site-packages/comoonics/enterprisecopy/ComEnterpriseCopy.py", line 112, in doAllsets self.currentset.doCopy() File "/usr/lib/python2.4/site-packages/comoonics/enterprisecopy/ComLVMCopyset.py", line 94, in doCopy self.prepareSource() File "/usr/lib/python2.4/site-packages/comoonics/enterprisecopy/ComLVMCopyset.py", line 127, in prepareSource self.source.prepareAsSource() File "/usr/lib/python2.4/site-packages/comoonics/enterprisecopy/ComLVMCopyObject.py", line 35, in prepareAsSource self.getVolumeGroup().init_from_disk() File "/usr/lib/python2.4/site-packages/comoonics/ComLVM.py", line 744, in init_from_disk LinuxVolumeManager.has_lvm() File "/usr/lib/python2.4/site-packages/comoonics/ComLVM.py", line 60, in has_lvm raise RuntimeError("LVM could not read lvm cache file") RuntimeError: LVM could not read lvm cache file
-------------------com-ec : INFO Undoing 4 sets--------------------
This error is a result of a changed LVM cache location in RHEL 5.
The cache file was relocated from /etc/lvm/.cache to /etc/lvm/cache/.cache
The exception is raided in the following source code:
/usr/lib/python2.4/site-packages/comoonics/ComLVM.py 59 if not os.access("/etc/lvm/.cache", os.R_OK): 60 raise RuntimeError("LVM could not read lvm cache file") 61
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): release candidate
How reproducible: always
Steps to Reproduce: 1.com-ec -d -a -x /opt/atix/comoonics-cs/xsl/localclone.xsl archive-clone.xml 2. 3.
Actual results: fails
Expected results: succeeds
Additional info:
A symlink has been created as a quick workaround to further text com-ec archive clone.

the following patch should add RHEL5 lvm cache file to the verification...
Index: ComLVM.py =================================================================== RCS file: /usr/ATIX/CVSROOT/nashead2004/management/comoonics-clustersuite/python/lib/comoonics/ComLVM.py,v retrieving revision 1.8 diff -u -r1.8 ComLVM.py --- ComLVM.py 22 Aug 2007 14:13:40 -0000 1.8 +++ ComLVM.py 23 Jan 2008 14:25:50 -0000 @@ -56,7 +56,7 @@ if not (os.access(CMD_LVM, os.X_OK)) and (os.access("/sbin/lvm", os.X_OK)): CMD_LVM="/sbin/lvm"
- if not os.access("/etc/lvm/.cache", os.R_OK): + if not os.access("/etc/lvm/.cache", os.R_OK) and not os.access("/etc/lvm/cache/.cache", os.R_OK): raise RuntimeError("LVM could not read lvm cache file")
f = open("/proc/devices", "r")
QA tests showed that the patch fixes the error caused by a relocated lvm cache file in RHEL5.
Bug cannot be closed yet!! QA tests have to be done with the released packages.
Patch in cvs
will be fixed in comoonics-cs-py-0.1-48 Please QA and close.
QA was successful.
closed

-------------------com-ec : INFO Undoing 5 sets--------------------
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): # rpm -qa | grep -e "comoonics\|gfs\|cman\|fence\|rgmanager"|sort cman-2.0.84-2.el5 comoonics-bootimage-1.3-33 comoonics-bootimage-fenceacksv-0.3-1 comoonics-bootimage-initscripts-1.3-6.el5 comoonics-bootimage-listfiles-1.3-6.el5 comoonics-cdsl-py-0.2-11 comoonics-cluster-py-0.1-13 comoonics-cs-py-0.1-54 comoonics-cs-xml-0.5-1 comoonics-cs-xsl-ec-0.5-19 comoonics-ec-py-0.1-36 comoonics-pythonosfix-py-0.1-1 gfs2-utils-0.1.44-1.el5 gfs-utils-0.1.17-1.el5 kmod-gfs-0.1.23-5.el5 rgmanager-2.0.38-2.el5 SysVinit-comoonics-2.86-14.atix.1
# cat /etc/redhat-release Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 5.2 (Tikanga)
How reproducible: always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. com-ec -d -x /opt/atix/comoonics-cs/xsl/localclone.xsl axqa02rc-localclone.xml
Actual results: com-ec localclone fails because the volumegroup that contains the active lv_sharedroot can't be deactivated during /usr/sbin/lvm vgchange -an vg_axqa02rc_sr
Why should vg_axqa02rc_sr be disabled at all?
Expected results: com-ec localclone works as expected.

the error may be caused by
ComCopyObject: def cleanupSource(self): if self.activated: self.vg.deactivate()
ComLVM: def deactivate(self): """ Deactivate volume groups by running vgchange -an. """
LinuxVolumeManager.has_lvm() (rc, rv) = ComSystem.execLocalStatusOutput(CMD_LVM+' vgchange -an '+str(self.getAttribute("name")))
if rc >> 8 != 0: raise RuntimeError("running vgchange of %s failed: %u, %s" % (str(self.getAttribute("name")), rc >> 8, rv))
This is funny, because self.activated defaults to False and will only be changed if the volume group is activated by com-ec.

com-ec is trying to activate the volumegroup vg_axqa02rc_sr, although it is already active. Thus, com-ec is trying to deactivate the volumegroup again, failing.

The problem occurs in line 404 of ComLVM: File "/usr/lib/python2.4/site-packages/comoonics/ComLVM.py", line 404, in init_from_disk (lvname, vgname, attrs, size, origin, snap, move, log, copy) = line.strip().split(':') ValueError: too many values to unpack
lvdisplay returns 10 values. The split command only accepts 9. This seems to be an "abi compatible" change in rhel5.2 :-/

This patch should fix the problem. In cvs as 1.15
### Eclipse Workspace Patch 1.0 #P Comoonics Clustersuite Index: python/lib/comoonics/ComLVM.py =================================================================== RCS file: /usr/ATIX/CVSROOT/nashead2004/management/comoonics-clustersuite/python/lib/comoonics/ComLVM.py,v retrieving revision 1.14 diff -u -r1.14 ComLVM.py --- python/lib/comoonics/ComLVM.py 29 Feb 2008 15:24:55 -0000 1.14 +++ python/lib/comoonics/ComLVM.py 24 Jun 2008 19:58:40 -0000 @@ -399,13 +399,22 @@ self.ondisk=False raise RuntimeError("running lvdisplay of %s failed: %u, %s, %s" % (str(self.parentvg.getAttribute("name"))+"/"+str(self.getAttribute("name")), rc,rv, stderr))
+ #FIXME + # an exception should be thrown, if lvdisplay output has changed the syntax. + # do we really need the for loop ? for line in rv: try: - (lvname, vgname, attrs, size, origin, snap, move, log, copy) = line.strip().split(':') + if line.count(":") == 8: + (lvname, vgname, attrs, size, origin, snap, move, log, copy) = line.strip().split(':') + else: + #This is for newer lvm implementations. + (lvname, vgname, attrs, size, origin, snap, move, log, copy, convert) = line.strip().split(':') self.setAttribute("attrs", attrs) self.setAttribute("size", long(math.floor(long(size) / (1024 * 1024)))) self.setAttribute("origin", origin) except: + #FIXME + # this should be fixed to get an exception if the values cannot be parsed. continue
if not ComSystem.isSimulate(): ### Eclipse Workspace Patch 1.0 #P Comoonics Clustersuite Index: python/lib/comoonics/ComLVM.py =================================================================== RCS file: /usr/ATIX/CVSROOT/nashead2004/management/comoonics-clustersuite/python/lib/comoonics/ComLVM.py,v retrieving revision 1.14 diff -u -r1.14 ComLVM.py --- python/lib/comoonics/ComLVM.py 29 Feb 2008 15:24:55 -0000 1.14 +++ python/lib/comoonics/ComLVM.py 24 Jun 2008 19:58:40 -0000 @@ -399,13 +399,22 @@ self.ondisk=False raise RuntimeError("running lvdisplay of %s failed: %u, %s, %s" % (str(self.parentvg.getAttribute("name"))+"/"+str(self.getAttribute("name")), rc,rv, stderr))
+ #FIXME + # an exception should be thrown, if lvdisplay output has changed the syntax. + # do we really need the for loop ? for line in rv: try: - (lvname, vgname, attrs, size, origin, snap, move, log, copy) = line.strip().split(':') + if line.count(":") == 8: + (lvname, vgname, attrs, size, origin, snap, move, log, copy) = line.strip().split(':') + else: + #This is for newer lvm implementations. + (lvname, vgname, attrs, size, origin, snap, move, log, copy, convert) = line.strip().split(':') self.setAttribute("attrs", attrs) self.setAttribute("size", long(math.floor(long(size) / (1024 * 1024)))) self.setAttribute("origin", origin) except: + #FIXME + # this should be fixed to get an exception if the values cannot be parsed. continue
